The meeting room:
> 
> The room that HYDRAS and CRYOTEK entered was not ove=
rly large but it
> was well appointed. The room was dominated by a large ta=
ble that ran

e was a

ew

> =
Along the rest of the table there were chairs positioned around
> strategic=
ally around it at different points to ensure that everyone
> had a seat.
> =

> There were windows looking to the outside of the ship as well, showing
>=
 a bit of the exterior and giving a magnificent view of the surround
> area=
. This room is what might be called the captain's ready room had
> the ship=
 actually been in flight, and it was a room that could easily
> serve as a =
meeting room for HYDRAS.
> 
> Already in the room FRACTYL was looking over =
some notes that he had,
> he looked up as HYDRAS entered followed by CROTEK=
 and of course by the
> ever present INFERNO, and then lastly by SCOURGE.
>=

elling me that as far as the optic can determine is that they are at
> the =
edge of a large jungle, one that spreads for miles. There is
> nothing stra=
nge about the rocks and trees and such but there is some
> sort of energy c=
oming from it."
> 
> SCOURGE cocked his head as if he was not sure how to e=
xplain the next
> part, "From what the sweeps are telling me, it reminds th=
em a little
> of Unicron, but it is different. They can't explain it." He g=
runted as
> they told him more. "They have flown around and from what they =
can see
> the energy is cutting off all communications, all video, audio, e=
very
> kind of transmission that they know of."
> 
> FRACTYL was listening =
with great interest as SCOURGE talked he making
> notes on his PADD as well=
. "I think I miht have a map of that." He
> said. "I have made a few survey=
s of the area in question from a few
> years ago."
> 
> He reached over and=
 pressed a few buttons and an image appeared on the

the viewscreen was indeed that of a large and
> dense jungle, one that cove=
rs a large area.

 'Rain Forest as

ungle

rolling and uneven terrain."
